meanings.definition: The state or quality of being unsociable or antisocial.
meanings.sent1: Her insociabilities made it challenging for her to make friends at school.
meanings.sent2: His insociabilities often led to him spending weekends alone.
meanings.sent3: Despite his insociabilities, he found solace in his books and hobbies.
meanings.sent4: The insociabilities of the old house gave it a mysterious and eerie aura.
meanings.sent5: The insociabilities of the cat made it a perfect pet for introverted individuals.

meanings.definition: Lack of willingness or ability to associate or socialize with others.
meanings.sent1: The child's insociabilities were evident when he avoided group activities.
meanings.sent2: Her insociabilities made it hard for her to participate in team projects.
meanings.sent3: Despite his insociabilities, he excelled in solitary tasks like painting.
meanings.sent4: The insociabilities of the shy student were like a protective shield around him.
meanings.sent5: The insociabilities of the clouds kept the sky devoid of any social gatherings.
